attributes.action: Make higher examinations more available to adult learners in Scotland
attributes.additional_details:
27% of people in Scotland with no qualifications. (Census)
£2,600 5 higher's privately (Edinburgh)
170,000 people unemployed in Scotland. (BBC)
£180 per higher, (local college) £720 in total (ILA will pay for one)
£720 paid by individual
Glasgow college only allow 3 higher's taken in one year, 5 needed for university. Adult learners should be allowed the chance to take their 5 higher's that were previously missed due to various reasons and circumstances.
Less than 3 access courses in Scotland.
attributes.background: Degree programmes such as medicine, law, veterinary, requires 5 higher's most do not achieve higher level in school. Colleges and schools do not offer the 5 needed in 1 year for access to university. Everyone deserves to take the higher exams. Higher's need to be more accessible to adult learners.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it. 

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here:

http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx
